Title: Wittgenstein An Introduction
Author: Joachim Schulte
Translator: William H. Brenner and John F. Holley
Publisher: State University of New York Press
Notes: Chapter 2 focuses on the Tractatus. 'How to read the Tractatus. Philosophy. World. Signs. Analysis and Picture. Saying and Show - Logic. Limits.' Very critical of perceived contradictions in the Tractatus.

Title: Wittgenstein's Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus Readers Guide
Author: Roger M. White
Notes: Context, Overview of Themes, then largely a reading accompaniment to the Tractatus. Reception and Influence. Further Reading.

Title: Wittgenstein's Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus
Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein, Translated by C.K. Ogden
Notes: 1922 by Routledge and Kegan Paul Ltd, 1955 Edition includes index and new introduction, 1999 Dover edition

Title: Philosophical Investigations
Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein, Translated by G.E.M. Anscombe
